duties_responsibilities.duty: Greet, pre-register and/or register patients in a courteous and professional manner, verify insurance benefits and check for the necessity of pre-certification, authorization and referral.
Provide professional, quality customer service, timely resolution to customer problems, and coordination of services to all customers.
Communicate revenue cycle related issues to patients, physicians, physician office staff, and other hospital colleagues.

Verify and obtain insurance benefits and required referrals and pre-certifications for patients that have not been pre-registered before the patient is treated, immediately after the patient arrives, or, if necessary, within one business day of the patient’s treatment.
Meet the needs of the patient, physician, physician office, and internal colleagues by maintaining good public relation skills.
Properly and accurately register patients utilizing legal name and date of birth and immediately issue patient identification bracelet at the end of the registration process.
Process admissions in a timely and accurate manner to include service location.
Maintain ongoing relationship with Care Coordination as required by departmental processes.
Strive to recognize the cultural beliefs, values, traditions, language preferences, and health practices of the communities that we serve.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's degree in Healthcare Administration or related field (Certification in Patient Access preferred)
